campaign.story:
Thy Realm is a strategic skirmish miniature game that uses cards for the figures.
Thy Realm Card/Miniature game will take you into a fantasy realm that you control by picking your own realm and heroes. Your figures are the card therefore, there will be no need to assemble or paint just go out of the box. This allows you to get more figures for your money and more time to play. With quick reference on the back to help speedy play.
Fight with your realm's heroes against other realms in strategic battles. Using cards that are your heroes miniature, you can move across the landscape of the realm. Each hero has its own abilities and or feats. There are five realms to choose from; Elvin, Dwarven, Human, Orc, and Dark.
In the Elven realm, you have graceful yet dangerous opponents with ranged attacks, fast movement and daring.
In the Dwarven realm, your army is solidly built with determined fighters that can withstand almost any assault.
The Human realm is a versatile army that can adapt to many situations.
The Orcs are heavy hitting and numerous.
The Dark Realm relies on fear and terror.
With your help we can bring this world to life and with more support we can expand on the realms.  There will be stretch goals for more heroes and creatures to bring more depth and excitement.

campaign.story:
UPDATE 6/6/14: Another Stretch Goal has been unlocked!
UPDATE 6/3/14: Another Stretch Goal has been unlocked!
The Game is Afoot and it’s up to you to solve the case! Sherlock Holmes and his cadre of clue-seeking companions are at your disposal as you attempt to catch some of the most notorious villains of Victorian era London in Victory Point Games’ I Say, Holmes! You’ll have a variety of different cards at your disposal, including Arrest, Clue, Alibi, and the I Say? cards, which call on Holmes and his friends to help discover the whereabouts of the criminal elements.
This new version of I Say, Holmes! features completely new custom art created by Clark Miller (Darkest Night, Trieste) showcased on 125 playing cards, alongside custom-shaped, laser-cut counters; we’ve brought all of our expertise to bear on making I Say, Holmes! into one of our most stunningly beautiful games yet.
If you’ve played the original version of I Say, Holmes! you’ll be happy to know that we’ve stayed true to the core game design, but we’ve updated a few of the mechanics and created a competitive campaign for the game. I Say, Holmes! features the following:
3 to 8 player support.
Quick and easy play, great for parties.
Around 30 minutes per round, even with new players.
You can download the rules here.
$1 You’re Awesome!: You’re an amazing person and we want to give you a hug.
$5 Thanks!: Not only are you awesome, but we’ll put your name in the “Thank You” section of the game.
$30 Early Bird!: You’ll receive a Kickstarter Exclusive version of I Say, Holmes! (MSRP $35) at a discounted price plus your name will be in the “Thank You” section of the game. Shipping within the US and Canada are included; please add $20 if you’re an International backer. 
$35 The Game Is Afoot!: You’ll receive a Kickstarter Exclusive version of I Say, Holmes! (MSRP $35) plus your name will be in the “Thank You” section of the game. Shipping within the US and Canada are included; please add $20 if you’re an International backer. 
$55 Games Are Afoot!?: You’ll receive a Kickstarter Exclusive version of I Say, Holmes! (MSRP $35) and a copy to give a friend (or to hoard for yourself), plus your name will be in the “Thank You” section of the game. Shipping within the US and Canada are included; please add $28 if you’re an International backer.
$60 Holmes Meets (Medieval) Italians: You’ll receive Kickstarter Exclusive versions of I Say, Holmes! (MSRP $35) and Trieste (MSRP $30), plus your name will be in the “Thank You” section of I Say, Holmes!. Shipping within the US and Canada are included; please add $28 if you’re an International backer. 
$65 Holmes Heads to Japan: You’ll receive Kickstarter Exclusive versions of I Say, Holmes! (MSRP $35) and Tenka – Shogun Edition (MSRP $35), plus your name will be in the “Thank You” section of I Say, Holmes!. Shipping within the US and Canada are included; please add $28 if you’re an International backer.
$85 Holmes’ World Tour: You’ll receive Kickstarter Exclusive versions of I Say, Holmes! (MSRP $35), Trieste (MSRP $30), and a copy of Tenka – Shogun Edition (MSRP $35), plus your name will be in the “Thank You” section of I Say, Holmes!. Shipping within the US and Canada are included; please add $35 if you’re an International backer.
$125 Holmes Gets (Wood) Burned: You’ll receive a Kickstarter Exclusive version of I Say, Holmes! in a custom-made wooden box (MSRP Unknown) plus your name will be in the “Thank You” section of the game. Shipping within the US and Canada are included; please add $28 if you’re an International backer. 
$150 Even More (Wood) Burned Holmes: You’ll receive a Kickstarter Exclusive version of I Say, Holmes! in a custom-made wooden box with custom-made wooden counters (MSRP Unknown) plus your name will be in the “Thank You” section of the game. Shipping within the US and Canada are included; please add $28 if you’re an International backer. 
$250 Holmes Investigates Your Design: You’ll receive a Kickstarter Exclusive version of I Say, Holmes! (MSRP $35) and our Board Games Producer will review your personal game design with his development team as a top priority; plus your name will be in the “Thank You” section of the game. Shipping within the US and Canada are included; please add $20 if you’re an International backer. 
$1,000 Opposed to Holmes: You’ll receive a Kickstarter Exclusive version of I Say, Holmes! (MSRP $35) and we’ll have our artist, Clark Miller, create a new villain for the Kickstarter Exclusive version based on you; plus your name will be in the “Thank You” section of the game. Shipping within the US and Canada are included; please add $20 if you’re an International backer.
I Say, Holmes! was inspired by Gibson Games’ Sherlock Holmes: The Card Game (1991), but it takes the basic mechanic and adds a great deal of depth and strategy around it; it will feel familiar to fans of the old game, but there are plenty of new and exciting elements to keep them playing for a long time. The 2014 Gold Banner Edition of I Say, Holmes! will keep that idea going with the addition of the competitive campaign, which has a variety of ways for you to score victory points in each hand before Holmes retires in His Last Bow.
When Victory Point Games (Facebook | Twitter) was founded by Alan Emrich in 2007, it started in Alan’s attic, with the games having a “garage” feel; the focus was squarely on the gameplay rather than fancy components and flashy graphics. Moving forward to 2014, whether the game is designed by a VPG insider or an outside designer, we now develop and manufacture everything in our own production facilities in Costa Mesa, CA. Over the years, we’ve slowly increased our component quality to our modern standard, known as Gold Banner; this includes printing in the full CMYK range, laser-cut counters, custom-cut paper components, and packaging games in Victory Point Games boxes with custom-produced slipcovers.
Now that we have all these tools available, we want to give the Gold Banner treatment to I Say, Holmes!, and one of the last component upgrades we need to present you with the best version of the game possible is improved card quality … which is where Playper comes into play.
Playper is a specially designed type of paper from Arjo Wiggins for high-end, mass-produced playing cards that can be used in a regular commercial grade printer, like the kind we have at Victory Point Games. This will let us make cards that are similar to those in other high-end games, since Playper is used to make a number of titles, including some extremely popular CCGs (collectible card games). We created various Playper cards from the samples we were sent and you can see the difference between our current and new card quality in the main video above. 
As a Kickstarter backer for I Say, Holmes! you’ll not only be one of the first people to receive a copy of the new Gold Banner version of the game, but you’ll receive your game in a Kickstarter Exclusive slipcover and the front of the rules will have matching art.
***FOR INTERNATIONAL ORDERS: Contact us for add-on shipping costs.***
Richark Wilkins (Box of Delights Board Game Reviews) has a video review of I Say, Holmes!
Chris Meussen has written up a review on Today in Board Games! Click here to read the review.
All rewards have U.S. and Canadian shipping and handling already included! International backers, please add additional stated amounts in each pledge for shipping and handling to everywhere else in the world. We did a country-by-country breakdown of the actual packages and weights to determine these average amounts. All sales are final. Packages may be insured by your request, and all claims for damaged packages/goods must be made with the shipping carrier.
Bulk Orders
Anyone who would like to place a bulk order, such as retailers or distributors, should contact us directly at distribution@victorypointgames.com or through Kickstarter and we’ll be happy to work with you to get you set up with whatever you need.
  Comic Quest, one of our local comic and game shops, graciously allowed us to film some of their game night attendees playing I Say, Holmes!; we want to thank Comic Quest for helping us to prepare our video for Kickstarter as well as supporting our company in numerous other ways.
*Appearance of Final Published Product May Differ From Images Shown.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We at Victory Point Games have a long history of developing and publishing games, with over 100 titles released since our founding in 2007; in 2013 alone we released 22 full titles, 4 expansions, and 2 mini games (known as Bagged Game Originals). At this point, we’re completely ready to release I Say, Holmes! as a Gold Banner Game and could do so immediately, but we need your help to get the Playper to make this game truly shine. 

There are two potential risks with this project:

1. Meeting Demand: As everything is done in-house at our Costa Mesa, CA, location, games are produced at a slower rate (approximately 75 to 100 games a day) than at the mass-production facilities many other publishers use. However, we can start manufacturing games as soon as the Playper arrives, which we’ve been told should be just a couple of weeks after payments are made. Additionally, since games are produced in small batches, we don’t have to wait for all of the games to be built in an overseas facility, shipped to us in the US, and then out to all of our backers; once we have the Playper, we can immediately start production and we will start to ship games out as soon as they’re available.

2. New Materials/Processes: We have tested Playper in small batches, so we know it will work with our machinery, but one of the biggest reasons we want to make this change is that Playper is actually better aligned with our equipment specifications while also increasing quality. Our current paperstock for cards is slightly too thick for our printer and cutter, which causes the paper to slip and increases the margin of error; Playper will decrease waste and increase our component quality without requiring any change in the way we do things.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Twitter - @theRealPotFarm — Facebook - PotFarm
Confused by all the options? May we recommend our new tier by popular demand?!:
Get the board game that lets you grow weed. A must have collector's item for board game fanatics and fans of cannabis culture!
Pot Farm: The Board Game is inspired by our underground, cult-hit game on Facebook, Pot Farm. Featuring 2-to-4 player weed harvesting action, Farmers take turns growing outrageous plants, buying improvements for their own farm and competing to see who is the ultimate Pot Farmer!
Watch out for Ranger Dick. Each turn players must choose whether to maintain positive “protection” levels comparatively to their Neighbours, otherwise Ranger Dick might confiscate their weed. Different items on your farm provide or take away overall protection level. Play balls to the wall with high-risk and even higher rewards, or go the safer route and sick Ranger Dick on your rivals. Whoever has the most valuable Farm and weed in their Stash wins the game!
How to Play Pot Farm: The Board Game
  120 colorful, punch out weed tokens featuring your favorite crops like Maui Waui, Purple Kush, and Sweet Tooth!
88 textured, high quality playing cards with an emphasis on the "Euro" feel that is used for high-end board games! (40 Store Cards, 24 Mystery Crate Cards, 24 Ranger Cards).
4 Farm Placards crafted to perfection. This is the base of all your farming and marijuana-growing needs!
1 Main Placard providing a handy space to place all the card decks and organize the discard piles!
1 Seed Bag to hold all your weed. Stash your stash here, man! Made of 100% woven Hemp!
1 Rule Book to help you out when you're stoned and stuck!
Expected MSRP: $40 (plus shipping).
You Decide the Rewards!
We will give our backer community a chance to vote for their favorite design! It's going to be SWEEEEET!

The following Stretch Goals will be for ALL TIERS WITH A COPY OF THE GAME!

campaign.story:
Black Market Warehouse is the first game being offered by Fire Squadron. It is a simple to learn card game that can be played by 2-4 players in about 30 minutes. You must use goods found on the black market to fill contracts you will acquire throughout the game. At the same time, you'll have opportunities to hit your opponents warehouses using hired hands. This won’t only slow them but it can stop them in their tracks!
Black Market Warehouse is the first game in the series of Black Market themed games. Each Black Market game that will come out in the future is designed to be added onto Black Market Warehouse. What that means is that this game will grow over time.
Prototype: This is NOT final Quality!!!
Here is a link to the PDF of the rules:
http://firesquadron.com/blackmarket/Rules.pdf
Here are the full rules for Black Market Warehouse. Click the images for a larger view. Keep in mind, all rules subject to editing changes!
Black Market Warehouse received a user review of an early print and play version of the game. To see his thoughts and a quick run down of the rules watch the video below! Keep in mind, the print and play version has been modified with bigger cards, and it's going out to each backer pledge #2 and above! Exciting!
Each game released by Fire Squadron is "Fire Tested”. “Fire Testing” involves a two step process:
1. Each game has gone through hours of play testing to ensure that rules make sense, are cohesive, and is an enjoyable gaming experience.
2. Once the Fire Squadron community has our games, we will listen to suggestions for new rules or changes to exiting rules. In our own gaming experience, we’ve added multiple house rules to almost all of our games. While house rules are fun, having rules not sanctioned by the gaming company creates issues when playing with different sets of friends. We want to avoid this. Through our web based community, we will provide regular updates, allow house rules to go up for votes, and provide other forms of constant support for our games. We know how important it is to be heard by a game company when you find a rule that doesn't work. We will listen and react quickly to all forms of feedback and suggestions.
When you get your copy, join the community at www.firesquadron.com. Let your voice and suggestions be heard! We look forward to it.

For an additional cost, you can receive the Black Market Warehouse Item Catalog featuring descriptions for all 70 items found in the game!

Fire Squadron would like to first thank you for your support! With out it, we wouldn’t be able to make this happen. Additionally, we would like to thank all of our game testers who put in many hours and gave us constructive feedback. 
Finally, we’d like to thank Leon and his staff at Wingo games. His support and ideas truly helped in the preparation for production.

Thanks again everyone!

"Pixel Glory is a unique combination of mechanics and a lighthearted theme that come together to produce an engaging and fun experience around the table." - Tox of CritsHappen.com
"Takes the very essence of pixelated dungeon crawling and crams it in 30 minutes." - Got Game Testers
"There has been a huge resurgence of pixel style artwork in both video and tabletop games, and I’m quite alright with that.  Pixel Glory uses this style to build an auction, dungeon delving, deck building game. This three attack combo is a knockout." - Jason Hancock
"We had a lot of fun with Pixel Glory there [Gen Con] and more fun since." - Jason Tagmire
You play a wizard who along with a few other wizards are about to embark on a quest to save a village from a dungeon! However, you are a selfish, greedy, fame-driven wizard who is all about their own personal glory, and the other members in your group are equally self-driven.  While you and the other wizards may in appearance be working together to kill all the monsters, only the player that deals fatal damage to the monster gets to add the kill to their collection and get the fame for it.  

The first phase of the game has wizards in town learning their spells via an auction-based draft.  The wizards then enter the dungeon with their deck of spells where they will be clearing out the dungeon.  
Art has been updated
Steep Discount: Over a 50% MSRP discount for Kickstarter backers!  
We need you: We can not print this game without your help. We've covered the initial costs, but we can not manufacture and ship the game without your support.
 Pixel Glory is being published by the Zafty team. The game was designed by Frank Alberts and Russell Ng with art by Russell Ng. Frank is an industry professional working in project management roles as well as being the game designer of SNAFU and other projects to be released by publishers later this year. Russell is a jack of all trades, fresh out of school with a Computer Science degree from Hunter College. Frank and Russell gained a large amount of inspiration for Pixel Glory while playing old-school games on Russell's home-made arcade console.
Snafu is a real-time cooperative party game that plays in sixty seconds that is being published by the Zafty team. It's a mix of Go-Fish, Curses, Kings, and Pit. For more information on the game, you can check out its Kickstarter page here, or watch this video

campaign.story:
Sakura is a competitive game for 2-4 players set in feudal Japan. It is easy to learn, lightning-fast to play (typically under 30 minutes), and does not have player elimination. 
Despite the elegantly simple design, Sakura offers a wide range of strategic options as you build the map, collect resources, recruit an army and attack other cities. There are elements of modular map building, dice-based attacks, and modifier cards. Fans of Japanese culture will notice the historical setting and the custom kanji calligraphy. You will love the organic, wooden soldier pieces which in themselves pay homage to the traditional Japanese game Shogi.
Sakura, meaning “cherry blossom”, is an important symbol in Japanese culture. Poets have sometimes compared cherry blossoms to soldiers within vast armies. These ethereal blossoms can also represent the souls of the fallen.
Click here to download our rule book as a PDF document. We want you to have all possible access to Sakura before you get your copy in December. Please forgive the lack of any professional graphic design... that will come with time!
日本の: Click here to download our provisional rulebook in Japanese!
Français: Click here to download our provisional rule book in French!
This video shows an abbreviated walk-through of a 2-player game, as well as going over the very basics of the rules:
Watch this 3-player game walk-through to understand the more advanced rules and strategies... this will give you a better feel for the full game experience compared to the 2-player walk-through:
 Click here to visit David's full review at Club Fantasci.
 Click here to visit the full 3rd-party review of Sakura over at Indie Conquest.
We were so excited to be featured on DJ Grandpa's podcast! Be sure to skip to around 8:05 to hear Sakura's portion... check out our episode by clicking on the icon above, or clicking here!
We have been fortunate to work with the Board Game Designer's Guild of Utah for close to a year. They are a group of gamers who meet twice a month and help play-test board games as they are being developed. The Guild has put Sakura through the gauntlet. We have received praise and constructive criticism. After months of effort, Sakura has earned the Guild's coveted stamp of approval. This signifies that we have a thoroughly solid rule book and game mechanics. This is a stamp that we will proudly display on the cover of our game box.
Do you have a printer and a pair of scissors? With a little elbow grease, you can make the print-and-play version at home months before the regular production version is ready! Your pledge at any level will get you a link to a printable Sakura PDF. 
For backers of the full production game, both regular and heirloom edition, we offer 2 extra, unique maps as an Add-On item for $10. We will include them with your game at no additional shipping cost. This will bring your total maps to 6, and give you that much more variety for your 2-4 player games!  
We're making a limited number of beautifully hand-made Sakura games. These deluxe editions will include all stretch goals. The game is housed in a carpenter-made cherry wood box with our Sakura kanji etched onto the top. Soldier pieces are also laser etched. Game maps are backed in wood. 4 custom wooden abacuses are included to help tally resources. Coins are made of hand-forged pewter. You will be playing on a work of art. Now shipping internationally and EU friendly!  
Crowdfunding is awesome. We love how Kickstarter gives the "little guy" a chance to share big ideas with the world. Sakura is my big idea, and I want as many people to enjoy it as possible.
Free shipping within the USA!
Canada, Mexico: Please add $15 to your pledge
EU: Please add $25 to your pledge
Australia: Please add $30 to your pledge
Everywhere else: Please add $35 to your pledge
We are proud to offer EU-friendly shipping! This means that Sakura will ship from within the EU, and EU backers will not have to pay additional customs, etc. on top of their pledges + shipping. Brad, our manufacturing manager, has years of experience shipping to the EU. We've got your back! 
At this time, only the regular version of Sakura will be shipped internationally. If you live outside the USA, please add the correct amount on top of your pledge in order for us to ship you your game. For example, if you pledged at the SUPER EARLY BIRD level with $48, and you live in Germany, your total pledge would need to be $48 + $25 = $73.
Each international backer outside the EU is responsible for customs, etc. which may be charged upon delivery.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our first Kickstarter project, but that doesn't mean we are jumping into this blindfolded. On the contrary, we have spent a year in close contact with the Board Game Designer's Guild of Utah, along with several Kickstarter veterans in preparation for our own debut. We've heard horror stories and success stories, and we're committed with all we've got to be a success! 

Common risks with Kickstarter board games: 

Production delays - It's hard to anticipate manufacturing delays, errors and miscommunication. We have already submitted several prototype designs to our manufacturer and they have processed all costs involved and manufacturing dates. We're as prepared as we could be in this department... but rest assured that we will be incredibly open with all our loyal supporters in what our status is along the way. If we're late for any reason, you'll know why. We won't be satisfied until we have a game that matches our vision.

Shaky game mechanics - This is a huge deal for me. Sometimes a start-up company can have a great original idea, but lack the skills to bring it to its full potential. That is not us. With Sakura, we have exhaustively play-tested it with hundreds of gamers. We have earned the coveted stamp of approval from the Board Game Designer's Guild of Utah. They drag games through the gauntlet, and only approve games with solid game mechanics and rule books. We will post our rule book and video walk-throughs so you can be familiar with Sakura before you support us. We're confident you're going to love it!

Shipping problems - At first, this seems inconspicuous, but shipping issues are among the most migraine-inducing challenges for any Kickstarter. Despite being a small start-up company, we will deliver quality customer support. Yes, we're shipping internationally, and we hope our international backers will be patient with the mail carriers. We want to bring Sakura to the world, even if that means a lot more work on our end!

Thank you for your trust in us. We don't take your trust lightly!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

 Dig Down Dwarf is a fast-paced press-your-luck dice game that is also the winner of the Micro Game Challenge! 128 designs were entered into the contest and Dig Down Dwarf was unanimously picked #1 overall by the judges! The Micro Game Challenge was judged by board game critic Cyrus Kirby, who is better known as Father Geek, and by the podcast team at All Us Geeks. Here is what they said...
Dig Down Dwarf is a fast and casual game that is fun for all ages and all skill levels. Newcomers will be attracted to the easy-to-learn rules and press-your-luck mechanics, while skilled gamers will love the ability to alter dice rolls by spending gems. There is a bit of something for everyone, and the quick playtime and portability make it a great travel game and an outstanding filler game as well.
Your support will allow us to produce this great game and get it into the hands of people all over the world to enjoy! Kickstarter allows us to manufacture a high quality product that we can all be proud of. As an Indie Publisher we thank you for your pledge!

Stretch Goals are our way of giving back to you in the case that we over-fund! campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our goal is to make a quality product and we understand the challenges of doing so. Our focus is to stay engaged with both our manufacturers and backers to keep everyone on the same page and informed. An informed backer is a happy backer.

If challenges arise, we will hit them head on. Sometimes an issue can cause a delay, and while delays are typically avoided, producing the the best product is always our end goal. Again, open communication with our backers is key.

All fulfillment will done in house via the use of USPS. We have our quotes from manufacturers in hand and all artwork outside of possible stretch rewards is done.

We also have experience with Kickstarter, having run 5 successful campaigns for Plague The Card Game, Zogar's Gaze, Tasnia, Neptune, and Four Tribes. We feel that this experience gives us a good advantage if and when any issues arise.

All of our previous projects have been shipped to backers with the exception of Four Tribes which is not due until September. Of the four projects we have delivered, three were on time, and only one had a minor delay. Again, we always keep an open line of communication with our backers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello Folks!
My latest solo-play design just launched last night and things are rolling! Gate is a medieval horror game where you are trying to protect your stronghold from invading vile creatures from the local forest. It uses deck-building as its driving mechanic. It comes housed in a small sturdy hinged tin with full-color printing. You can literally keep it in your front pocket!
Gate is being ran as a Crowd Sale on the Game Crafter. What does that mean? Well a crowd sale is much like any other crowd-funding platform, except the Game Crafter both manufactures and fulfills all orders. This means you, the backer, get your game much faster than traditional methods. In stead of forced, and often trivial, stretch goals, crowd sales instead lower the price for all backers whenever we hit certain milestones! That is right, the game actually just drops n price for everyone instead of adding stretch goals. Gate is complete and doesn't need any useless added content. Instead early adopters are rewarded with money back in their pockets.

campaign.story:
We have some very cool stretch goals planned throughout the campaign.  Including upgrading the wooden cubes to meeples and mini meeples (that would be 44 totally sweet meeples).  We also have a couple of Exclusive Artifact cards that will only be available by backing the game prior to it's release as well as plenty of new artifacts and locations to unlock. 
With your support the folks at Meeple Source are creating custom Meeples for the Generals as an add-on if we hit our funding goal.
As for the price, we expect Conquest of Speros to retail for a minimum of $24.99. We've chosen our pledge levels so that our backers get a great game at a great price with some cool stuff.

If you would like a copy of the Lost Treasures Expansion, just add $7 to your pledge by clicking Manage Pledge from the Conquest of Speros Kickstarter page and we'll sort it out after the Kickstarter ends with our pledge manager.
This play mat measures 24”x10” and is perfect for setting up the Skirmish area of the game. It will only be available to our Kickstarter backers as well as a promotional item and special events and conventions.
If you would like a copy of the Play Mat, just add $12 to your pledge by clicking Manage Pledge from the Conquest of Speros Kickstarter page and we'll sort it out after the Kickstarter ends with our pledge manager.
You can download the latest version of the rules here.  Watch our how to play video!
To break the game play down to its core, every turn you discard a card, take that card's action, then choose one of 4 set actions to take for the turn.  Every interaction in the game stems from those simple mechanics.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Almost all of the art and graphics are done and the game has been play tested extensively. The only real pitfall that might arise is in the manufacturing of the game, when it comes to manufacturing there is always the potential for setbacks. However, this is not our first attempt at this, we have worked with other publishers in the past, so we understand what it takes to get a game to market.

updates.update_userinfo: Grey Fox Newsletter and contest to win FREE GAMES!
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone, 
I wanted to let you know that we are launching a Grey Fox Games newsletter and will be giving away some free games to our early subscribers!
All our subscribers will be entered into a drawing on October 20th. Six lucky winners will receive a free copy of a game from our line and 1 grand prize winner will receive a copy of EVERY game in our line! That means Champions of Midgard, Captain's Wager, Operation FAUST, Conquest of Speros, Draco Magi, and Expedition: Famous Explorers are all up for grabs!

updates.update_userinfo: Digital Conquest of Speros and a few other tidbits.
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,
Hopefully most of you have received your games by now and are having fun conquering Speros (at the expense of your friends). For those of you in the U.S. that have not received, please let me know as it means there has been an issue.  If you are outside the U.S., it's not time to panic yet, but in about another week, it might be.
We have recently made an agreement with a new company called Tabletopia, to make digital versions of all of our titles.  These will only be interfaces and will not include an AI, but we still think it's pretty cool.  In addition, we are working with them to get our much anticipated upcoming title, Champions of Midgard, up and running in about a week and lasting until the end of the campaign (It will come back at the launch).  Since the game is still about 4 weeks away, it gives you a chance to check it out early!

Hello backers,
It feels almost surreal to type this, but in about 19 hours from now, all non-EU copies will be officially shipped.  Packing has begun and shipping will be completed by around 4:00 tomorrow. I cannot wait for you to finally have the game in your hands.  All Oceanic shipments have gone out already.  EU shipment is still in the port, but I am hopeful it will be clear any day now and on its way to Morning Players to be shipped out.  They are very fast, so once they get it, it will not take long.

Hello all,
Your patience and perseverance are finally about to pay off.  I am overjoyed to report that I just confirmed today that the shipment has cleared customs and will arrive on Monday. Hooray!!!
The plan is to organize everything from the shipment and start shipping out all non-EU and non-Asia/Pacific orders on Wednesday. I will send an update once that process is complete, but the end is truly in sight and I could not be happier for it and the fact that you finally get to play Conquest of Speros!

Hi All,
Our boat seems to still be on schedule (woohoo!). I plan on locking down the addresses tomorrow in anticipation of getting everything ready for shipment. If for some reason that is going to be a problem for you (you're moving, etc.), please send me your email address to shane@greyfoxgames.com, with a brief explanation of your issue. I will make sure we get your game to you at the proper address.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping update and a new social deduction game.
updates.update_content:
Hello backers,
I wanted to let you know that the boat with CoS is scheduled to hit the port on 7/14. We should still have time to get the stuff shipped out and have copies available for sale at GenCon.
Also, we recently launched our newest KS, Deception: Murder in Hong Kong. It is social deduction game where each player plays the role of an investigator, but one is actually the murderer. Can you find out who in time? This game was shown to us by Jolly Thinkers out of Hong Kong and we really loved it, so we decided to re-implement some elements and co-publish with them. The game was previously called CS-Files (and can be looked op on BGG under that name or the new one). It also already has the Dice Tower Seal of Excellence and there is a video of the review for CS-Files on our campaign page. If you like social deduction games, please check it out here:

Hello Backers,
I wanted to let you know that the game is officially on the water and moving it's way here.

http://www.jocsailings.com/VoyageDetail.aspx?SID=31204&CID=101&VID=28056&VOID=4470151

Hello All,
So my forwarding agent just confirmed that our game is officially in his hands and booked for voyage on a boat some time next week.  As soon as I have the vessel information, I will share that with you so that you can track it's progress to the port in Tampa.  From there it's a one day trip to our warehouse and then the job of getting them sent out will begin.  Also, I will be finalizing and locking down the backerkit orders sometime next week (no changes will be able to be made to rewards after that), so please make sure you have completed your surveys (there are 50 people that have yet to do so) as I cannot ship you anything until that happens.

project_data.project_name: Conquest of Speros

campaign.story:
Here is our website: http://customgamelab.com
We will have an email newsletter sign-up sheet on our home-page, so you can receive regular updates from us.
In a couple days we'll be launching a forum to discuss design ideas, get feedback, and stay up to date with CGL news. Click here to see that forum once it launches.
If you'd like to follow updates specific to this project or order some dice for yourself, this link will bet set up to bring you to the right place.
----------
Help us provide the gaming community with customized 16mm (standard size) D6 dice - with more colors, shapes, and sizes available when we reach higher funding levels!
Note: Remember, your reward can be divided into multiple designs and even multiple shipments. When splitting it into multiple shipments, you just pay the shipping charges on any shipment after the first.

Example: If you pledge for two dozen dice, you can get 24 of the same design OR 4 each of 6 different designs OR 24 completely different designs (or anything in between). And your reward can be split into as many shipments as you like.
These add-ons are available to anyone with a pledge level of $6 or more (anyone actually receiving a shipment). You can include as many add-ons with your pledge as you like.

Shipping: No additional shipping charges required for add-ons.


Right now, if you want to make custom dice for a game prototype, print-n-play game, or just to customize your old Yahtzee! game, it'll cost you several dollars per die - before shipping.
We see a way to provide the same quality engraved custom dice at a fraction of the cost. But we can't do it without your help, we need funds to purchase the necessary supplies and equipment (primarily meaning thousands of dice and a Trotec laser engraver)!
Here are some examples of people we've teamed up with so far to bring you cool designs:
We've teamed up with Potluck Games, the creators of Dungeon Dice, and have some exciting news as a result! They are designing an official die for Dungeon Dice that will be available exclusively through CGL.
Plus they have agreed to allow us to use a bunch of the official art from Dungeon Dice. The art will be available on our website so you can design your own custom mods, expansions, and house rules for Dungeon Dice and the icons on your custom dice will match those on the originals!

We've also teamed up with Common Man Games to create a custom dice pack for their award winning game Police Precinct. And if enough people are interested in that pack, they'll receive a mystery die for SNITCH Free of charge! That die will also become available for others to claim with their pledge rewards once it's unlocked. More details on Update #8. Both Police Precinct and SNITCH are available through their current KS project.
With the announcement of full-color printing, we also announced a collaboration with Nick Hayes to bring his game Chunky Fighters to the masses.
Tesh of Project Khopesh ran a successful Kickstarter project several months ago for metal Tinker Dice and would like to see those designs made reality in plastic as well. So he has shared with us the designs for d6 Tinker Dice as well as Fudge Tinker Dice. Here's what the design looks like as well as a picture of the finished product in metal.
We've teamed up with Sarcastic Robot to make Firewall, a strategy dice game, available.
P.D. Magnus is working with us to produce dice featuring the suits of his award winning six suit deck of cards, the Decktet.
Check out Update #11 for a much fuller list of collaborations.
These are just a handful of those that have shown us their designs. And there are many more of our 1,000+ backers with design ideas they haven't shown us.
These designs will all be available when the project gets funded, but what should be even more exciting is not the designs I've created, but the opportunity for ANYONE to create their own custom design and make it available to the world. There are literally infinite possibilities. I hope the few I've posted here can help inspire some ideas.
Shipping: Shipping to the US is included with all reward levels, additional $7 required for international shipping.
Sharing is caring! One of the most critical aspects of making this project a success is getting the word out to everyone that might be interested. But we need your help to do it.

If you help us out by sharing the project URL on Facebook or including it in one of your Tweets, we'll reward all of our backers by unlocking new colors of paint to fill the designs with. We figure this is better than paying for advertising because it allows us to reward even more for your support!

While you're at it, feel free to follow us on Twitter @CustomGameLab and like our fanpage on Facebook:
Just for clarification, these are not new colors of dice, but new colors of paint to fill the engraved designs with. New colors of dice will be unlocked through monetary stretch goals.
Designs we can promise to be available upon success of this project, include the following themes: Promo dice, Elvish script, weapons, winner's dice, loser's dice, tetrominoes, moon phases, standard d6, dragon dice, chess dice, ninja dice, card suit dice, crown and anchor dice, fudge dice (standard and outline), text based dice, cheater's dice, binary dice, weather dice, Mayan dice, Emoticon dice, Chinese dice, Roman numeral dice, hexadecimal color choosing dice, RGB color choosing dice, and math constants dice. The Myst based D'ni numeral dice have also received approval for commercial licensing from Cyan Worlds Inc and will be available.

We also fully expect hundreds if not thousands of other designs to be made available soon after our website launches as our backers begin to create their own designs and make them available for others to order. Rest assured you will have plenty of great options to choose from!
In fact during the course of this project, we have already begun working with some designers to announce designs they will be making available on our site. We've been sharing these in our updates, but also plan to add some of them to our main project page. There's some exciting new partnerships forming - go check out the updates to see some of the cool designs you'll be able to choose from!

Credits: Music for the video, "Please Listen Carefully" by Jahzaar available on FreeMusicArchive.org under Creative Commons licensing, and some of the graphics on this page came from various contributors on Game-Icons.net There will be more specific attributions for the graphics on our site once it is launched, if you would like more info feel free to contact me.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We will be working with multiple manufacturers to source all of our equipment and supplies from lasers to dice to paints. There's always a potential risk of delay or other issues when working with companies you have no control over. However, I have already been in contact with each of these companies to ask questions and receive samples. Each of them is a reputable company and has been very responsive so far.

I've been asked what I will do if this project is wildly successful - will I still be able to deliver? Not only will I still be able to create your dice, but the process get's streamlined even further the more it scales. If it does well enough, I will be able to buy an even faster laser with a larger engraving area allowing me to engrave more dice at once. If necessary, I have room in my shop to add more than one laser as well (plus available help as necessary).

In short: Overfunding is a good thing, it would allow us to get better equipment, potentially more equipment (which will both speed things up), and more dice options for you!

As with any Kickstarter, this will be a large time investment not only in creating dice but also in delivering them.

I have worked from home for the past couple of years, and am prepared to dedicate the time needed to deliver your rewards for this project! I have experience mailing lots of packages from previous business experiences and I know the local postmaster personally - but I'm sure we'll be seeing each other even more when this project is funded!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
It’s January - a new year. The therapy I’ve been doing has made a huge impact on my health so far. The therapy continues, and I’m hoping that there will be progress continually made through the coming months. My stamina is way higher than it was. There is still a lot of room for improvement, but things are going in the right direction again now.
The laser has not been sold yet, but I have still been working on getting things set up so that I can start refunding some of you. And I think we’re at a point where that can begin.

I don't know what else to say other than that I have failed myself, this project, and you. 
I see three ways primarily that I failed: 
1) Inexperience in doing something at this scale left me underprepared for some of the obstacles I ran into. Were it not for the other two failure points, I am confident this one could have been overcome, but it did contribute nonetheless.
 2) My failure to recognize the problems with my health before they cascaded out of control was by far the biggest contribution to my failure to complete this project. In retrospect, I can see some of the warning signs, but at the time I just thought I was tired and stressed right up until my body began to fail catastrophically.

updates.update_userinfo: Pulmonology update and moving to a better climate
updates.update_content:
Earlier this week, I finally got to see the pulmonologist (this was the fastest they could get me in... seemed like forever).
Essentially, it ended up confirming what we already suspected but with more accurate results and some finer details.
My lungs are capable of holding a normal volume of air though it is intensely painful to make that happen.

Hey All,
It's me again – I am still alive.
First off, thanks for all the positive feedback and support in response to my last update. I can't express how much that meant/means in this hard time.
About a month has passed since then, so I wanted to update you on my health status.

Hey everyone.
I know it's been a long time since I've posted an update and especially since I mentioned being close to taking orders last time it has been unsettling for many of you to see that much time pass.
So I want to start this out by saying I have not forgotten about this, I have not moved on from it, and I am still completely committed to fulfilling this Kickstarter.

Hey everyone.
I know it's been longer than expected since my last update.  I also am aware that this has been a cause of concern for a number of you.  I will share some details as to why another month passed when I was hopeful to get the website up around the holidays (I know quite a few of you appreciate openness in discussing what the hangup have been along the way, so I want to keep that going).  But that will have to wait for now.  I want this to be a very brief update to let you know I am still working feverishly on this project.

I have been really pushing to get this website live despite the hangups.  And as I was getting close to being able to put a significant portion of it online (as opposed running locally on my computer), I stayed up all night last night and worked through the day today to get it up.

It is still not finished, the aesthetics in particular have been neglected to focus on the functionality (the vast majority of the code goes into making the backend work - then once that is all put together it will need to be beautified on the surface).  And not all of the functionality is enabled yet, but a huge portion of the core is there and even more in the background that isn't visible from the surface yet.

It is not ready to place an order yet, but will be soon.  The technical capability for you to upload an image for each face and compile that into a die design is there.  I have not had time to put together instructions/FAQs/or walkthroughs of the design process yet either.  But I wanted to go ahead and put it up .

Hey everyone! We're getting really close, and I can't tell you how exciting that feels. I was going to try to squeeze this update and the next update together, but it didn't quite work out.
I am hoping that with a few more all-nighters (turns out that's the easiest time to work on the programming without distraction), I'll be able to open up the website for design submissions. I am still hopeful this will happen before Christmas as I mentioned before, but it's going to be tight.  We'll see if I can pull it off.

Another month has passed, which means it's time for an update.­
It's November now, which means we've officially missed the projected delivery date I had set when I launched the project. I won't try to waste your time sugar coating that or make excuses. I am sorry it happened, and I hope to have learned from the mistakes made in planning and prioritizing the timeline for this project.
At this point though, I think we can all agree this project will make better progress if I focus my time looking forward rather than back.
With that in mind, I've got some samples of what I've been working on to show you.

Once again, it's been about a month since my last report, so I'm here to check in again.
I know some of you have drawn more attention back to this campaign as it gets closer to October. October had been my forecasted delivery date – and honestly I had expected to begin shipping dice much sooner than that.
But as I've detailed in my previous updates, the laser came nearly two months after I expected it to, and it was another month and a half before I was able to get it calibrated (not to mention a couple problems I was having with the software and Windows 8) – leaving a full 3 months between the time I anticipated getting the laser and the time I actually had a laser that fully functioned as it should.

updates.update_userinfo: The 6 ½ Pound Titan has Arrived!
updates.update_content:
In my last update, I was excitedly letting you all know about the 300 pound mechanical monster that had arrived.
In the time since, while much of the gaming world was prepping for Gen Con, we've had a new arrival – this one was much smaller. When she joined us, Adaiah Gamliel Warren was 6 pounds 9 ounces (though she is growing quickly). Both she and her mother are doing well (and I made it through alright too!).

campaign.story:
This new card game from Matt Riddle and Ben Pinchback, designers of the hit game Fleet, is for 2-6 players, takes 20-30 minutes, and is only $16. Pledge now for this great game in a small box! 
Shipping is included in all pledge levels!
FULLY FUNDED!
Thank you to everyone that has backed so far! We are so excited and based on the funding curves we have a great shot at getting a few stretch goals knocked out! Speaking of...
STRETCH GOALS
15K: The Triumvirate Eggs Eggspansion (3 Egg Cards) - UNLOCKED!
20K: The Brood Eggs Eggspansion (6 Egg Cards)
Overview
Eggs and Empires is a fast-playing card game in which players will use matching decks of Empire Cards that contain Adventurers numbered 1-10. On each turn, all players will select one card from their hand and play it simultaneously in an attempt to collect Good Eggs that are worth VP while avoiding the nasty Exploding Eggs that lose VP!
Typically, the player who played the highest Adventurer chooses an Egg first, then the player with the second highest Adventurer picks an Egg, and so on until all revealed Eggs are collected. Ah, but it's not that simple! Each Adventurer has a unique power that can affect the order in which Eggs are selected. The powers interact in strategic and awesome ways so that every hand is exciting and different.
Outwit your opponents to collect as many Dragon Eggs as possible — while avoiding those wicked Exploding Eggs!
Story
Eggs from the dragons of Ridback Mountain are valuable — not quite as valuable as gold following the last market fluctuation, but still TOTALLY worth the hassle, especially since it's not like YOU are climbing the mountain and searching through dragon caves. That's what peasants are for...
All the empires have sent their intrepid Adventurers out to collect Eggs, but not all will succeed! It gets crowded on Ridback Mountain, and there are only so many dragon Eggs to go around — not to mention that the dragons have started mixing Exploding Eggs into their nests, and those hurt.
Pledge Info
We wanted to keep this campaign very simple. Eggs and Empires is a great game offered at a great price! Simply select the reward to the right based on your location. Shipping and handling and all stretch goals are included in the price! 
There are NO add ons or extra costs, but additional copies can be added to any pledge level at the cost of that pledge level. So for three copies, a US backer would pledge $16+$16+$16 = $48. Canada backers would pledge $50 for two copies, $25+$25.
Canadian and international backers should make sure to take advantage of the 4 pack to save on shipping costs!
This project is EU friendly! Eggs and Empires will ship from a warehouse in the Netherlands.
What is in the box?
Eggs and Empires includes:
102 deluxe linen 2.5" x 3.5" cards w/ amazing art by Cristian Chihaia
1 awesome stand up Egg Tie Breaker Marker
13 Egg Chits for Pub/Con scoring
Mildly humorous and easy to teach Rulebook
All of that comes in a high quality small and portable box that can be put in your pocket or game bag to be taken and played anywhere! Eggs and Empires has a small play footprint even at the higher player counts.
The Eggs and Empires box is 5.375" by 4.25" by 1.0".
The Adventurers and a few Eggs
Gameplay Video!
Reviews and Links
boardgamegeek.com game page (link)
Full rules on BGG: (link)
"Matt & Ben introduced me to Eggs & Empires in a pub at GenCon and it was one of the best games I played while I was at the con. It was so good, in fact, that I wanted to publish it with Dice Hate Me Games - but Gryphon Games beat me to it!"
- Chris Kirkman Dice Hate Me Games
"Often the downside of trick taking games is that you can get on auto-pilot and it can get boring. Not so in Eggs and Empires. The wanting and not wanting to take tricks paired with having to pay attention to your card powers and those of what the other players have played keep you constantly engaged. This is a great game which plays well with all player counts and in the perfect amount of time!"
- Dan Patriss - The Geek All Stars
"Eggs and Empires is a definite winner in my book. The only complaint I have about it is that it's not available right now."
- Jonathan Liu - GeekDad.com full review here
"Following their success with Fleet, this design duo have come up with another game that's a hit with the League. Eggs & Empires perfectly fills the role of a quick, entertaining and accessible deduction-based card game that novice and hardcore gamers alike will surely enjoy!"
- Dan Halstad The League of Nonsensical Gamers nonsensicalgamers.com full review here
"Eggs and Empires is a quick and enjoyable light strategy card game... This Dragon Egg collecting game is a strong addition to any family game collection"
- Cathe Post of Geekmom.com
Ryan Moore Counselor/Father/Gamer reviews Eggs and Empires here!
Interview about Eggs and Empires with The Inquisitive Meeple (here)
Eggs and Empires Designer Diary on BGG (here)
Eggs and Empires Review by Eric Handler (here)
"Small card game with eggcellent gameplay !" - Chris of todayinboardgames.com(here)
Eggs and Empires Review by Ken Grazier of Geek-Craft.com (here)
"Overall, Eggs and Empires is a great simple game that is quick to teach, easy to learn, and a lot of fun. The simple game play makes it accessible to many kinds of players, and the luck of the draw is balanced very well against the strategy that comes with a small deck and each player having the same cards." - Ken Grazier Geek-Craft.com
60 Second Game Review of Eggs and Empires
Backer Reward
Downloadable print and play with really cool alternative art!
All backers will receive access to a set of PnP files that can be downloaded and played immediately! They utilize really cool black and white sketch art from Cristian!
Stretch Goals
15K: The Triumvirate Eggs Eggspansion (3 Egg Cards)
The Triumvirate Eggs are fun way to spice up the Egg Deck with some new and fun choices. There are only three Triumvirate Eggs in the deck and if you collect one by itself it will explode... but get another one and they stabilize and become Good Eggs! 
25K: The Brood Eggs Eggspansion (6 Egg Cards)
The Brood Eggs are a larger set of Eggs that can be mixed into the Egg Deck. One by itself isn't worth much, but the more of them you collect, the more they are worth!
Blooper Reel!
 Avatar
Download it and display it proudly!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We stand by our products, but sometimes issues do happen. Please contact our customer service department with regard to any such issues within 90 days of receiving any copies of the games covered in this Eggs and Empires project.

Shipping issues are relatively uncommon, but they do sometimes occur, especially when shipping to destinations outside of the US. We will obtain tracking information when it is possible, but sometimes it is not. We cannot guarantee that there will not be shipping problems, as we cannot guarantee the service and reliability of the various postal/delivery services involved around the world. You will have to assume that risk along with us.

To put it simply, you will get everything you are promised when you pledge to one of our Kickstarter Projects, and it will be delivered to you in as timely a manner as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey everyone! Please continue getting your address changes to customer-service@eagle-gryphon.com.  
Good news! The boat has landed and E&E is currently on a train heading to the Gryphon compound with a stop in Chicago for customs along the way. That means if everything goes smoothly, NA backers will begin to see copies arrive mid to end of the week of Nov 17. That is good news for several reasons, most importantly because its SOON, but also because if everything lines up then Eggs and Empires can be made available at BGGCon--for both play (demo copies will be there) and sale! Gryphon will NOT be able to do backer pick ups because they are going to devote all of their time making sure backer copies get out ASAP, but some of you may get it in time to take with you or if not, play it there and have a nice surprise waiting at home when you return! Everyone else - like Ben and I - not fortunate enough to be going to BGGCon can look forward to getting their copies in November--just as estimated in the KS Project! There is always the USPS factor, but hopefully most of us will have E&E in hand soon! Very exciting!

campaign.story:
Far into the distant near future, the universe has proven to be a huge disappointment. People are largely mediocre.  Cheeseburgers are dry and flavorless.  But, one remote planet may hold the key to epicness.  Nay, make that UBER EPICNESS!  As the general of your own rag-tag army of mercenaries, it's time to seize your destiny. 
-- Draft your fighting force from among 12 unique characters
-- Build your base
-- Defend your flag
-- Capture your opponent's flag
-- Scavenge the battlefield for powerful Artifacts
-- Achieve Epic Goals
-- Forge alliances or go it alone
The team with the most points is the winner.
So draw your weapons.
Shame your friends.
Claim victory.
Become UBER EPIC. 
And have the best cheeseburger ever.
UBER EPIC is a turn-based, social strategy, board game of attack, defense, and revenge.   
How many players?          2-12
How old?                          Ages 13+
How long to learn?          10-15 minutes
How long to play?            Games average 60-90 minutes
3D movement and line-of-sight (LOS) targeting
The concepts of turn-based movement and of LOS targeting aren’t new. But UBER EPIC brings them to life in ways never seen before. In UBER EPIC, every player has the ability to customize the layout of his/her headquarters with 3D wall pieces that can provide cover for your characters and obstacles for your opponents. But don’t get too comfy. Walls can be scaled, or even destroyed. And anything you can see, you can shoot. The reverse is also true.
A combat system that DOESN'T take a calculator and degree in philosophy to figure out
We designed the combat in UBER EPIC to be both simple and intuitive. Farther-away enemies are harder to hit but earn more points. Closer enemies are easier to hit but earn fewer points. Melee attacks are based on the higher dice roll between two characters. There is a nifty Targeting Meter that tells you exactly how far away an enemy is, and exactly what you need to roll to score a hit. Hit characters are paralyzed and inactive for the next round. Pretty easy, right?
Vendetta Shots
Remember those old Westerns where the good guy gets shot, but with his last, dying breath, fires one final bullet to exact his vengeance? We wanted that for UBER EPIC. If your character is hit with a ranged attack, you get one last Vendetta Shot to take your attacker down with you. Successful Vendetta Shots can stop your opponents’ plans cold.
UBER EPIC is unpredictable 
Unpredictability and randomness are built into the core of UBER EPIC, making not just every game, but every turn, unique.  We've created several game mechanics that will keep you guessing.  
Changing turn order 
Every round, the character movement order is randomized.  Going early and going late both have distinct advantages.  If you go early, you set the tone for the round.  You shape the board, and you have first dibs at deciding which characters to try and eliminate.  But going late can also have major upsides.  If you survive to the end of the round, many of the foes blocking your path may have already been eliminated, making the going much easier.   Either way, things change quickly from turn to turn, so being able to adapt your strategy on the fly is a must.  
Artifacts 
Artifact tokens are strewn across the battlefield.  Step on an Artifact token, and randomly draw one of the 25 potential Artifact cards from the deck.  Some Artifacts will give you a huge advantage at a crucial moment. Some Artifacts will actually harm you. Scavenge at your own risk.
UBER EPIC accommodates multiple play styles
Since each character has his/her own unique strength and special ability, victory in UBER EPIC can be achieved through a variety of play styles and strategies.
Are you a zerger? Did you idolize Leroy Jenkins?  Do you want to run full bore at your opponent's flag and never look back?
Are you a camper? The cautious sort?  Is your idea of fun hunkering down inside your own base and taking pot-shots at your opponents as they come creeping by?
Are you a hoarder?  Do you want to scavenge the battlefield to collect all the Artifacts so no one else can have ALL THE FUN that you're having? 
Are you a sneaker?  The sort with a good poker face? Do you think you can secretly fulfill the conditions of your Epic Goals without your opponents being any the wiser? 
UBER EPIC doesn’t take itself too seriously
When we created UBER EPIC, we wanted something that would be easy enough for casual gamers to pick up, but also fun and strategic enough to impress even the most hardcore Gamer. UBER EPIC is the perfect party game. It’s fun to play, easy to learn, and allows for plenty of opportunities to shame your friends. We also wanted a game with a sense of humor. If you feel like a change from game writing that sounds like it came out of The Wheel of Time’s ® reject pile, you’ll love UBER EPIC.
BLACK-LIGHT!!!!!!
Fulfilling our Kickstarter goal will allow us to produce every piece and card of UBER EPIC with black-light compatibility.  If you've never played a game in black light before, you're in for a treat.  Just take a look at some of our play test footage!  (NOTE: black-light bulbs not included in UBER EPIC game set).
The finished, boxed set of UBER EPIC will include:
Giddy Games isn’t a huge gaming company, and we’re not trying to be. We are gamers just like you. We were playing D&D® out of the red box and we always try for the "longest road" in Settlers®.
UBER EPIC started out as a pet project that we created to play with our friends at gaming conventions and parties.  The first prototype was made out of Playmobil®, Legos®, and handwritten index cards.  Both kids and adults really seemed to like it, so we decided to jump right into the world of game making.
Why did we choose a Kickstarter campagin for UBER EPIC? Because the internet is an awesome place (metaphysically speaking) where dreams come true. Ten years ago, none of this would have been possible. Seriously, take a second to think about just how cool all of this is – thousands of people independently coming together to help great projects get made.
We want to self publish because we want to see UBER EPIC grow into a community. We want people like us to write their own variations of the game rules and post them on our website for others  to enjoy. We want people to suggest ways to make it even better.
UBER EPIC has been a passion and a dream many years in the making.  Through a lot of collaboration and hard work, this dream is nearly a reality.  GiddyGames, LLC has a lot of people to thank:
To the creative team at Imaginigami:  Kevin, your imagination and belief in our dream made all of this possible.  We wouldn't be here if not for you.  Paul, your artwork is creative, beautiful, and dynamic all rolled into one.  Jarrett, you are the funniest, most creative thinker we've ever met, even if you don't ever remember meeting us.  Thanks for convincing us to keep the Fish of Good Fortune card. 
To MakeIt Labs, Bow High School,  and Karen at Printers Square, thanks for working with us through thick and thin and helping us get the prototype established. 
To our friends and family, thanks for the many MANY rounds of play testing we forced on you.  You helped tweak and mold UBER EPIC into the awesome, exciting game it has become. 
"Weirdly, I find myself attracted to The Evil Genius.  I thought I'd be more of a Valkyrie kind of guy, but I guess not."  --- Awkward College Student
"Having 'The Fish of Good Fortune' find me worthy was the most validating experience of my entire life.  Thanks UBER EPIC!" --- Anonymous Play tester
"Are the electrified pants a real thing?  Because if not, they should be."  --- He just said his name was "Rob."
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our biggest risks lie in the stages we must outsource, namely, the manufacturing process. We have already partnered with a reputable manufacturer, but delays may occur in the process that are outside our control. Things like materials shortages, labor strikes, anarchist revolts, Cthulhu... and all the other unpleasant stuff they talk about on NPR. But no one wants that. Not us, not them, not you, not Cthulhu. Cthulhu is tired. So cross your fingers and hope for the best. 

We are smart, honorable people who really want to get this game out into the world. We will do our best to beat the crap out of any challenges that may arise, and meet all timetables as quickly as possible. Except in the case of zombies. If zombies attack, all bets are off. We’re sorry, but we believe in full transparency, and we didn’t want to kick off the Kickstarter campaign with a lie. But let’s be fair, if the zombie apocalypse happens, you’re going to have other priorities too. 
 
Zombie apocalypse aside, we will communicate regularly with our backers throughout the production and delivery processes.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
     We would like to say a huge thank you to all of you for showing your support.  We appreciate the trust you've put in us.  Unfortunately, it does not look like we are going to reach our goal for this campaign however, we are not going to let that stop us.  We plan to learn from this experience (a lot of good lessons learned), make a few changes, and launch again!  We would love to have everyone's support for the second launch so to keep you updated on when that will be, it is important that you either "like" us on facebook under Uber Epic or private message us with your email address.  Part of our plan of attack for the next campaign is to increase our social media presence.  Telling your friends and posting our facebook page would certainly help us do that and would be GREATLY appreciated.  We are going to be working very hard to do what we can to get you Uber Epic.  It's a great game that's a lot of fun to play with gamers and non-gamers alike and we want you to be able to play.   It will come!

Thank you to all of our beginning backers!  It's a very exciting start.  Now we need to spread the word!  Right now Uber Epic has just over 200 likes on fb.  Help us reach the 225 mark and we'll add an extra Epic Goal card to the game.  Thank you again for your support!

campaign.story:
Know what the hardest part about being a writer is? Motivation. Your creative juices are flowing, the ideas are churning around in your head, but at the end of the day, if your only boss is you, you're in trouble, especially if your boss is a laid-back softie who'll let you get away with anything. Suddenly your valuable project time is being spent seeing if you can FINALLY beat that last boss on FTL, or if that quirky How To Basic guy on YouTube has made another gut buster.
Many great books have died that way.
Enter you guys. Your money goes to keeping the nice people at Lulu employed for helping me self-publish, and keeps shipping companies happy by getting the product out to you, but mostly, what your money does is make me accountable to you, and the value of that can't be understated. Suddenly I've got a bunch of really nice people who paid me (in advance, no less!) to deliver a quality product on a deadline, and my reputation - both as a professional writer and as a stand up guy with integrity who delivers on my promises - is suddenly on the line. Can you say ROCKET FUEL? In fact, it's such a life-changing concept that I think I'll write a book on it someday. Pressured by the Masses. Starring you. Where Kickstarter hopefuls are injected with a drug that makes them drop dead if they miss the deadline. Ooooooh. 
But anyway, that's a project for the future. For my first professional gig I want to go back to my D&D roots and write a good old-fashioned medieval hero story, with a few quirks (quirks, here, being defined as "details I've always wanted to see in stories to add flavor to them that other writers never bothered with or never thought of"). My protagonist is a youngster eager to break out of his dull life who should really be careful what he wishes for. As his adventures unfold and he comes closer to realizing those dreams, he realizes that ascending to the big leagues is nothing to be cavalier about, and the joys and pleasures he's hoping to attain come with a lot of responsibility and loss. Is it worth it, in the end? Whether he thinks so is ultimately the question that the book, and any sequels it might spawn, will explore.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk, obviously, is that I die, get abducted by aliens, or am highly overestimating what I can accomplish under pressure. I've backed enough Kickstarter projects myself to know how frustrating delays can be, and how outraged you can get when someone you believed in fails to deliver. I have enough bad karma in my life without having any of that negative energy directed my way, so you can bet your bottom dollar (metaphorically, if it's LITERALLY your bottom dollar don't fund my project, go get FOOD) that I'll be doing my best to keep that stuff away from me.

I'm pretty sure we'll be fine. We're talking about a book that's already fully outlined with the first five chapters out of twenty four completely written, and a five month window to write the other nineteen, get the book to Lulu, have them print it, and send it out to people. Figure two chapters a week, that's got the book done in mid-July, a couple of weeks for editing, then a month to go off to the printers, look at a proof, and out to you. Should be early September, but I put October to allow for time for something to go wrong. Plus I already priced everything to make sure I'd have enough to get it done. Should be cake!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Writing Sample (excerpt of Chapter 1 Rough Draft)
updates.update_content:
Hey guys! So, who buys a book without being able to read a bit of it at the bookstore? Not me, that's for sure. ;) So here's a small scene from the first chapter to give you a feel for my protagonist and my writing style. 
-------------------------------------------------------------------
“You have got to get your head on straight,” my father insisted, passing me a plate of warm bread. “It's bad enough you waste three hours a day at that damn soldier school of yours; when you're here I need you focused on your duties here. A tavern doesn't run itself.” 
 I took the bread meekly and broke a piece off for myself, dipping it in the oil that my little sister had set out. We were all gathered around the small table in the back of the kitchen. Officially it was a staff break table, but it was the closest I'd ever known to a family dinner table in my life. My father arranged it so that, whenever possible, he and my mother and sister and I could all take our breaks at the same time when business was slow and eat our own dinner as a family.
